title: The 5 types of text structure

multiple-choice.question: What is the main topic being discussed by the speaker?
According to the speaker, what are the five main structures found in informational texts?

options.label: A
options.text: Description, Sequence, Cause and Effect, Problem and Solution, and Compare and Contrast

options.label: B
options.text: Description, Sequence, Cause and Effect, Compare and Contrast, and Chronology

options.label: C
options.text: Description, Sequence, Cause and Effect, Problem and Solution, and Timeline

options.label: D
options.text: Description, Sequence, Cause and Effect, Compare and Contrast, and Narrative

multiple-choice.question: What is the purpose of the structure called "Description" in a text?

options.label: A
options.text: To give events from way back to most recent

options.label: B
options.text: To explain the cause and effect of an event

options.label: C
options.text: To describe the topic and its characteristics using details and adjectives

options.label: D
options.text: To compare and contrast two or more things

multiple-choice.question: If a text contains the structure called "Sequence", what can you expect to find in it?

options.label: A
options.text: Details and adjectives that describe a topic

options.label: B
options.text: Dates and the words Next, then, before, first, second, and third, which help to organize events in chronological order

options.label: D
options.text: A comparison of two or more things

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: They were both built for the same purpose

options.label: C
options.text: They were both disrupted during construction

options.label: D
options.text: One was built as a church bell tower, while the other honored a Founding Father

options.label: A
options.text: The tower's tilt increased over time

options.label: B
options.text: The tower was built on soft soil

options.label: C
options.text: The tower was halted during construction due to war

options.label: D
options.text: The tower's construction was paused for the Civil War

multiple-choice.question: According to the speaker, what is the solution to the problem of the Leaning Tower of Pisa?

options.label: A
options.text: Removing earth from under the monument and adding weights to balance it, which helped to stabilize the tower

options.label: B
options.text: Building more floors to balance the tower

options.label: C
options.text: Stopping the construction of the tower

multiple-choice.question: What is the main idea being conveyed by the speaker when they say "You can compare and contrast all day, all day"?

options.label: A
options.text: That comparison and contrast are the most important text structures

options.label: B
options.text: That description and sequence are the most important text structures

options.label: C
options.text: That comparison and contrast are useful tools for understanding different ideas and making connections between them

options.label: D
options.text: That description and sequence are useful tools for understanding different ideas

multiple-choice.question: According to the speaker, what is the purpose of the structure called "Cause and Effect" in a text?

options.label: A
options.text: To describe the topic and its characteristics

options.label: B
options.text: To give events from way back to most recent

options.label: C
options.text: To explain the cause and effect of an event, helping readers understand why something happened

options.label: D
options.text: To compare and contrast two or more things

multiple-choice.question: What is the speaker emphasizing when they say "In text, I find description, sequence, cause and effect. You can compare and contrast all day, all day"?

options.label: A
options.text: That description, sequence, cause and effect are the most important text structures

options.label: B
options.text: That comparison and contrast are the most important text structures

options.label: C
options.text: That description, sequence, cause and effect, and comparison and contrast are all useful tools for understanding different ideas and making connections between them

options.label: D
options.text: That description, sequence, cause and effect, and comparison and contrast are all equally important
